description.p: You evoke a wave of billowing flame in the air. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 fire damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You briefly evoke a floating whip of lightning. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 lightning damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You conjure a floating thorny vine which vanishes after striking. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 piercing damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

element.name: Acid Mist
element.supports: Artificer, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Occultist

description.p: You conjure a misty puff ofacid. Until the spells ends, the mist fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the mist's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the mist's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

element.name: Churn Earth
element.supports: Artificer, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Occultist

description.p: You cause the earth to chum and roil like a rock grinder. Until the spells ends, the effect fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the effect's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 nonmagical bludgeoning damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the effect's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
Creatures that are prone or burrowing have disadvantage on the save.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You conjure a glowing orb of color that sears those it touches. Until the spells ends, the orb fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the orb's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 radiant damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the orb's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You conjure a spectral plant with waving, slicing leaves. Until the spells ends, the plant fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the plant's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 slashing damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the plant's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You conjure a flurry of icy snow. Until the spells ends, the flurry fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the flurry's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d8 cold damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it enters the flurry's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
Any creatures that are naturally adapted to cold environments are also immune to the spell.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
You shine a beam of light at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 radiant damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
You hurl a thin spear of yellow-blue lightning at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 lightning damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

As part of the action used to cast this spell you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one target within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. Your reach for this melee attack is the range of the spell instead of its normal reach and the attack also counts as a ranged spell attack.
Your weapon projects a blast, slash, or spike of wind toward your target. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th leveL the attack deals an extra 1d8 damage. At 11th level this increases to 2d8 bonus damage, and at 17th level the bonus increases to 3d8.

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause green-blue lightning to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes lightning damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d8 lightning damage to the target on a hit, and the lightning damage to the second creature increases to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 1 1th level (2d8 and 2d8) and 17th level (3d8 and 3d8).

setters.set: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

description.p: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause emerald acid to spray from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes acid damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d6 acid damage to the target on a hit, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by 1d6 at 11th level (2d6 and 2d6) and 17th level (3d6 and 3d6).

setters.set: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

description.p: You create a tugging vortex of howling wind that surrounds one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward you and then take 1d8 thunder damage if it is within 5 feet of you.
This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 1 1th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You conjure magic into a spinning blade of air pressure in your hand and use it to strike a creature or object that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the target is within 5 feet of you, you can choose to make a melee spell attack against it instead On a hit, the target takes 1d10 slashing damage. The blade vanishes at the end of the turn.
The spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You conjure magic into a snowball of magically cold ice in your hand and use it to strike a creature or object that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the target is within 5 feet of you, you can choose to make a melee spell attack against it instead On a hit, the target takes 1d10 cold damage. The snowball vanishes at the end of the turn.
The spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

element.name: Chill Wind
element.supports: Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Artificer, Occultist

description.p: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and chill the air around it. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 cold damage. The target is immune if there is no air surrounding it.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

element.name: Hot Flash
element.supports: Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Artificer, Occultist

description.p: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and heat the air around it to sweltering temperatures. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 fire damage. The target is immune if there is no air surrounding it.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

element.name: Thunderous Vibration
element.supports: Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Artificer, Occultist

description.p: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and violently shake it with a loud, ringing sound. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d10 thunder damage. The spell can be heard by creatures up to 100 feet away. This spell’s damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You channel primal magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to become wreathed in fire, ready to deliver a flaming attack. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. After you make the attack, your teeth or fingernails return to normal.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You channel primal magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to freeze into icicles, ready to deliver a frozen attack. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 cold damage. After you make the attack, your teeth or fingernails return to normal.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You channel primal magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to charge, ready to deliver an electrical attack. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 lightning damage. After you make the attack, your teeth or fingernails return to normal.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

An amber beam of petrifying magic streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. The target is immune to the spell if it cannot be petrified. The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Golden flames descend on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 fire damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw. The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

A column of silver light descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 cold damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw. The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

A thin bolt of golden lightning descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 lightning damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw. The spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
You create a momentary circle of crackling lightning around you. All other creatures within 5 feet of you must each succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 lightning damage.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
You create a momentary circle of acid that sweeps around you. All other creatures within 5 feet of you must each succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
You create a momentary cloud of hot cinders that swirls around you. All other creatures within 5 feet of you must each succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 fire damage.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
Your body sprouts with plantlike needles that burst outward before vanishing. All other creatures within 5 feet of you must each succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 piercing damage.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

element.name: Drain Heat
element.supports: Bard, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Artificer

description.p: You drain the heat from creatures in the area around yourself. Each creature other than you within range, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 cold damage.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You touch one creature and the sound of a harsh and judgemental choir fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 1d12 radiant damage.
The spell’s damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level (2d8 or 2d12), 11th level (3d8 or 3d12), and 17th level (4d8 or 4d12).

You attempt to twist one creature's legs or the ground from under them. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d4 nonmagical bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone.
This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

element.name: Wind Blast
element.supports: Artificer, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, KTHArtificer, Occultist

description.p: You conjure a roaring, thunderous wind that blasts toward your target. One creature you can see within range must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 1d6 thunder damage and if it is Large or smaller, you push it 10 feet away from you.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as spectral ashes that cover you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 fire damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the fire damage increase by 5 for each slot above 1st.

A protective magical force surrounds you, manifesting as salivating spectral mouths that cover you and your gear. You gain 5 temporary hit points for the duration. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 acid damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the temporary hit points and the acid damage increase by 5 for each slot above 1st.

As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, arcs of sea-green lightning branch, fork, and fan forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, blue-white tendrils of icy cold energy crawl forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

A flash of golden-yellow lightning streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 lightning damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light arcing on the target until then.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Reaction: you are being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by primordial storms. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

Reaction: you are being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by your thunderous voice, which manifests as a spectral wave of greenish energy. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

You create a curved spike of solidified acid and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 piercing damage. Hit or miss, the spike then explodes into a burst of liquid acid. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 acid damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the acid damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

setters.set: a drop of acid or a scorpion's stinger

description.p: You create a burning stone and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 bludgeoning damage. Hit or miss, the rock then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the fire damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

You create a spinning spectral blade made of storm-blue lightning and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 slashing damage. Hit or miss, the shard then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 lightning damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the lightning damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.
Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 fire damage as it is wreathed in flames.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.
Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 thunder damage as an incredibly loud ringing sound pounds within its body for a few moments.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.
Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 cold damage as your icy touch chills it to its bones.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during the spell’s duration, your weapon coats with a sticky acid, and the attack deals an extra 1d6 acid damage to the target and coats the target in corrosive acid. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d6 acid damage. On a successful save, the spells ends. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to clear the acid, or if some other effect removes the coating (such as the target being submerged in water), the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon flashes with light, and the attack deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage to the target. You are illuminated with a bright light until the start of your next turn. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked prone.

A small but powerful wave of water sweeps out from you before vanishing. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t pushed. In addition, the spell extinguishes unprotected flames in the area. While it lasts, the wave counts as five gallons of water.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.
You transform your hand into a flexible collection of sharpened tree branches. The branches extend from your arm and lasts for the duration.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the branches that has a reach of 10 feet. On a hit, the target takes 3d4 piercing damage, or you can choose to trip the target, dealing it no damage and knocking it prone instead.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the reach of the spell attack increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can conjure more branches in another hand as part of the same bonus action, and with two branches you can make two spell attacks using your action instead of only one.

A stroke of lightning 30 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

A blast of spiraling acid 20 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

You leap through space as a bolt of lightning, smashing into a foe as you pass between locations. You teleport to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. You can also choose up to one creature in a line 5 feet wide originating at the space you left and ending at the space you teleported to. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.
On a failed saving throw, the target takes 3d10 lightning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the maximum number of creatures you can target increases by one for each slot level above 2nd

A strong surge of roaring wind rockets you into the air. You fly up to 60 feet in a straight line and stop at the first creature you contact. You can choose to make a melee spell attack against the creature, hitting it with a magic barrier. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 thunder damage and 2d6 force damage, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. On a miss, the target takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

For this tum, your barrier grants you resistance to damage from falls, and falls do not knock you prone upon landing. Upon finishing the movement and attack caused by this spell you fall if you are still aloft, unless you can stop the fall.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the force damage dealt increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd

You fill the air with magical blue flame in a cube 5 feet on each side, centered on a point you choose within range. The flame sheds no light and cannot be doused. A creature takes 4d4 fire damage when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried are ignited.
At Higher Levels. when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

You fill the air with a cloud of misty acid in a cube 5 feet on each side, centered on a point you choose within range. A creature takes 4d4 acid damage when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. The area the cloud occupies is lightly obscured.
At Higher Levels. when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

You evoke a blade of crackling electricity in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action. You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the electric blade. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 lightning damage. The electric blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

You evoke a sunlit blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action. You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the bright blade. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 radiant damage. The bright blade sheds sunlight in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

A 5-foot-diameter sphere of crackling, sparking lightning appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere’s damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn. When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. The sphere ignites flammable objects not being worn or carried, and it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

setters.set: a bundle of wire, a pinch of sand, and a dusting of powdered iron

description.p: A 5-foot-diameter ball of soft but frigid snow appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere’s damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn. When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to thrum with an electric current. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 lightning damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again. If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn’t drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot above 2nd.

Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to freeze and cloud with ice. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 cold damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again. If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn’t drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot above 2nd.

A beam of ultrasound leaps from your outstretched finger to strike one creature that you can see within range. You make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 5d8 thunder damage and can't take reactions until the end of your next turn.

If damage dealt by this spell forces the target to make a saving throw to maintain concentration, the DC is increased by an amount equal to your spellcasting modifier (minimum +1) and the target has disadvantage on the saving throw.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

setters.set: white amber worth at least 150 gp

A sickly yellow cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range directly above you. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to rain down acid in this way again, targeting the same point or a different one.

description.p: Electrical energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can touch, shocking it with high voltage. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 8d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If you target a creature that is submerged or partially submerged in water, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

The target takes 8d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. If you target a creature that has resistance or immunity to cold damage, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

You touch a weapon and wreathe it in magical electricity. Until the spell ends, the weapon is magical if it wasn't already, and each time an attack using the weapon hits a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2d8 extra lightning damage from the attack.

When the area appears, each creature in the area takes 2d4 bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there takes 2d4 bludgeoning damage and must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

In addition, whenever a creature falls prone within the area or ends its turn while prone within the area, it takes 6d4 bludgeoning damage. This spell treats creatures that cannot be prone as if they are always prone instead.
This spell only affects creatures that are on the ground.

description.p: You point at a location within range, and a glowing 1-foot ball of searing hot cinders streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d4 fire damage and another 5d4 fire damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn. The spell ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 4th.

You create a wall of shimmering emerald-green acid on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot think, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot think. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 acid damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 acid damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

You create a wall of storm-blue electricity on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot think, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot think. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 lightning damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals 5d8 lightning damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

A swirling tunnel of crushing air and roaring sound erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 50-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 8d8 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes liquified by the pressure.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

setters.set: a small crystal or glass cone

description.p: Your hands evoke long talons of pointed flame as you create 4 lines, each 100 feet long and 5 feet wide, emanating from you in directions of your choice. Each line has its own direction and lines can overlap, but they must all fit within a 180 degree angle from you.

Each creature within the spell's area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each line area that they are within. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create an additional talon of flame for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure a pressurized spray of digestive acid that splits into smaller jets as you create 4 lines, each 100 feet long and 5 feet wide, emanating from you in directions ofyour choice. Each line has its own direction and lines can overlap, but they must all fit within a 180 degree angle from you.

Each creature within the spell's area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each line area that they are within. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create an additional jet of acid for each slot level above 5th.

setters.set: the bile of a green dragon

description.p: Your hands evoke tendrils of icy blue cold as you create 4 lines, each 100 feet long and 5 feet wide, emanating from you in directions ofyour choice. Each line has its own direction and lines can overlap, but they must all fit within a 180 degree angle from you.

Each creature within the spell's area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7d6 cold damage plus 1d6 cold damage for each line area that they are within. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create an additional tendril of cold for each slot level above 5th.

Each creature within the spell's area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7d6 radiant damage plus 1d6 radiant damage for each line area that they are within. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.=
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create an additional ray of light for each slot level above 5th.

description.p: A vertical column of icy starlight shines down from the heavens in a location you specify. Each creature in a 10-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4d6 cold damage and 4d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the cold damage or the radiant damage (your choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

A vertical column of roaring lightning and rumbling storm clouds strikes down from the heavens in a location you specify. Each creature in a 10-foot radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 4d6 lightning damage and 4d6 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the lightning damage or the thunder damage (your choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

You inflict a magical disease on a creature that you can see within range, forcing it to carry out some service or refrain from some action or course of activity as you decide. If the creature can understand you, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become charmed by you after 12 hours and for the duration of the spell. While the creature is charmed by you, it takes 5d10 psychic damage each time it acts in a manner directly counter to your instructions, but no more than once each day. A creature that can’t understand you is unaffected by the spell. You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. A remove curse, greater restoration, or wish spell also ends it, as well as any spell that cures disease.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the duration is 1 year. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level the spell lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

You bellow a determined prayer that calls down a dazing bolt of lightning from the heavens to crush a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 5d8 lightning damage and is stunned until the end of your next tum. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half damage and is not stunned
If the target is outside and underneath the sky, the spell's damage increases by 2d8.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

You bellow a determined prayer that calls down a pillar of whirling ice and snow from the heavens to crush a creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 5d8 cold damage and is stunned until the end of your next tum. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half damage and is not stunned
If the target is outside and underneath the sky, the spell's damage increases by 2d8.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

Green acid wreathes one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 8d6 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also burns for the spell’s duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes 4d6 acid damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful one.
If damage from this spell kills a target, the target is liquified.
You wreathe yourself in weightless magical armoring crafted from plates of amber-colored sound waves. You gain the following benefits for the duration:

ul.li: When a creature within 10 feet ofyou hits you with a melee attack, the plates burst with noise. The attacker takes 3d6 thunder damage, and other creatures ofyour choice within 10 feet of you take half that damage.
Attacks made against you have disadvantage.
You have resistance to thunder damage.

description.p: In addition, if you are critically hit before the spell ends, you can use your reaction to end the spell causing the plates to explode in a cacophany of sound. The attack misses, and the attacker as well as each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become deafened for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turns.
When the spell ends, the magical plates vanish.
You wreathe yourself in weightless magical armoring crafted from plates of dark stormcloud which cracles with lightning. You gain the following benefits for the duration:

ul.li: When a creature within 10 feet ofyou hits you with a melee attack, the clouds burst with bolts of lightning. The attacker takes 3d6 lightning damage, and other creatures ofyour choice within 10 feet ofyou take half that damage.
Attacks made against you have disadvantage.
You have resistance to lightning damage.

description.p: In addition, if you are critically hit before the spell ends, you can use your reaction to end the spell causing the plates to explode in a protective crash of thunder. The attack misses, and the attacker as well as each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away and be knocked prone.
When the spell ends, the magical plates vanish.

A bead of fiery force rockets from your fingertips toward a point you can see within range, where it explodes into a wave of fire, force, and air pressure that expands to a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d10 fire damage, is deafened until the end of your next turn, is knocked prone, and is pushed 20 feet away from the center of the area. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not knocked prone, pushed, or deafened.

Unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 20 feet away from the center of the area by the spell's effect. Flammable objects not being worn or carried are set ablaze.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d10 and the distance a creature is pushed increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure a belching portal to a minor plane of acid which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The portal sheds bright green light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The portal is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the portal to release searing acid in a blast. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

Area Blast. Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the portal, a 40-foot cone blasting from the portal, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the portal. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Constructs and earth elementals have disadvantage on this roll.

Single Target. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the portal that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the portal's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 acid damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against constructs and earth elementals.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure a huge spectral dragon's head made of blue flame which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The dragon's head sheds bright blue light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The dragon is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the dragon to release blazing fire in a blast. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

Area Blast. Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the dragon, a 40-foot cone blasting from the dragon, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the dragon. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Creatures that are ablaze have disadvantage on this roll.

Single Target. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the dragon that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the dragon's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 fire damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against creatures that are ablaze.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure a spinning coil of sparking blue lightning in the air at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The coil sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The coil is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the coil to release lightning in a blast. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

Area Blast. Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the coil, a 40-foot cone blasting from the coil, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the coil. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Creatures wearing metal armor have disadvantage on this roll.

Single Target. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the coil that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the coil's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 lightning damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against creatures wearing metal armor.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure a spectral bell which hovers in the air at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The bell is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the bell to release a deafening toll. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

Area Blast. Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the bell, a 40-foot cone blasting from the bell, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the bell. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Targets made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal have disadvantage on this roll.

Single Target. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the bell that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the bell's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 cold damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against targets made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure an elemental spirit of winter which rises from the ground at a point that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. The spirit is incorporeal and does not occupy space. You can use a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends to cause the spirit to exhale a frosty mist. Choose one of the following two options each time you do so.

Area Blast. Choose either a 15-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the spirit, a 40-foot cone blasting from the spirit, or a line 80 feet long and 5 feet wide blasting from the spirit. Each creature in the chosen area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Plants and water elementals have disadvantage on this roll.

Single Target. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of the spirit that you can see. Determine cover and line of effect for this attack as if it was made from the spirit's location rather than your location. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 cold damage. You have advantage on this attack roll against plants and water elementals.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

Choose a point you can see within range inside a body of water. The portions of that body of water that fit inside a 5O-foot cube centered on that point boil until the spell ends. Any creature that ends its tum within the area takes 7d4 fire damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature is blinded until the end of its next tum. Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried also take damage at the end of each of your turns.

While the spell lasts, your magic keeps the steam in the area from mingling with the surrounding water. When the spell ends, the steam returns to its original form as water. This does not alter the composition of the water.

You hurl fire in the shape of an eagle at one creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 + 15 fire damage and the spell ends as the eagle rips and tears with its flame talons. This spell ignores resistance, and targets with vulnerability to slashing damage have vulnerability to the spell's damage.

On a miss, the eagle soars past the target and begins flying through the air on its own, seeking out another target. Note the location of your target when you cast the spell At the start of your next turn, you must repeat the spell attack (no action) against the creature within range that is now closest to that space, possibly even attacking yourself. If this attack misses or has no target, repeat this process using the location of the last target when the spell attacked it, repeating the attack each round until the spell ends.

The eagle uses blindsight to find its targets, not vision, and it weaves around obstacles to reach its target, so subsequent attacks after the first ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and do not suffer disadvantage if you cannot see the target. If multiple creatures are tied for being the closest to the eagle when you repeat the attack, you choose which one the eagle attacks.
The eagle damages objects in its path that aren't being worn or carried When this spell destroys an object or kills a creature, it is sliced in twain.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.

You conjure acid in the shape of a dragon which races after one creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 + 15 acid damage as the dragon slashes with caustic claws and teeth and the spell ends. This spell ignores resistance, and targets with vulnerability to slashing damage have vulnerability to the spell's damage.

You evoke lightning in the shape of a flying snake which seeks one creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 + 15 lightning damage as the serpent constricts it like a slicing garrote and the spell ends. This spell ignores resistance, and targets with vulnerability to slashing damage have vulnerability to the spell's damage.

On a miss, the snake flies past the target and begins flying through the air on its own, seeking out another target. Note the location ofyour target when you cast the spell At the start of your next turn, you must repeat the spell attack (no action) against the creature within range that is now closest to that space, possibly even attacking yourself. If this attack misses or has no target, repeat this process using the location of the last target when the spell attacked it, repeating the attack each round until the spell ends.

If multiple creatures are tied for being the closest to the snake when you repeat the attack, you choose which one the snake attacks.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.

You create a vertical wall of whirling flame made solid by interplanar magic. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it, and its space is difficult terrain. When a creature enters the wall’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 6d10 fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.
The spell ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

You create helical coils of burning flame that branch toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three branches then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the coils.
A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 10d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects targeted by the spell catch fire.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional coil leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

setters.set: a pinch of saltpeter and charcoal

description.p: You create a beam of white light that shines toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three multicolored beams then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the beams.

A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 9d8 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The space of each target is filled with with dim light until the end of your next turn.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional beam leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

A wave of dimensional energy ripples out in a 60-foot-radius sphere from a point within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes 8d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one as its body is subjected to the astral light of the space between the Outer Planes.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.

setters.set: the powder of a crushed pearl worth at least 500 gp

description.p: A thin blue ray springs from your pointing finger to a target that you can see within range. The target can be a creature, an object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by wall of force.

A creature targeted by this spell must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 10d6 + 40 lightning damage as it is shocked by blasting, eradicating electricity. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

This spell automatically disintegrates a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of force, this spell disintegrates a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 3d6 for each slot level above 6th.

description.p: A bright red-orange flame springs from your pointing finger to a target that you can see within range. The target can be a creature, an object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by wall of force.
A creature targeted by this spell must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 10d6 + 40 fire damage. The target is incinerated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points

An incinerated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine black ashes. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

This spell automatically incinerates a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of force, this spell incinerates a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 3d6 for each slot level above 6th.

A thin, sickly yellow ray springs from your pointing finger to a target that you can see within range. The target can be a creature, an object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by wall of force.
A creature targeted by this spell must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 10d6 + 40 acid damage. The target is liquefied if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points

A liquefied creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a puddle of green slime. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

An amber globe of sound energy streaks from your fingertips to a point of your choice within range, where it explodes in a 60-foot-radius sphere. The explosion can be heard from up to 1 mile away. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d6 thunder damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. Any nonmagical objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried take half the spell's damage. You can refrain from firing the globe after completing the spell, if you wish. A small globe about the size of a sling stone, humming softly, appears in your hand. At any time, you or a creature you give the globe to can throw the globe (to a range of 40 feet) or hurl it with a sling (to the sling’s normal range). It explodes on impact, with the same effect as the normal casting of the spell. You can also set the globe down without detonating it. After 1 minute, if the globe hasn’t already detonated, it explodes.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 6th

You step through the Feywild, teleporting yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range. Immediately after you appear, a blast of sparkling fairy dust and magical energy courses out of the portal you stepped through. Each other creature within 30 feet ofyou must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d8 psychic damage and 3d8 radiant damage, it is charmed by you, and it is poisoned until the start of your next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage and isn't knocked charmed or poisoned.

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also teleport one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. That creature doesn't roll the saving throw. It must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this speli and there must be an unoccupied space within 5 feet ofyour destination space for the creature to appear in; otherwise, the creature is left behind.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radiant damage done increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.

Immediately after you appear, a flash of lightning and thunder bursts out of the portal you stepped through. Each other creature within 30 feet ofyou must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d8 lightning damage and 3d8 thunder damage, it is knocked prone, pushed 20 feet away, deafened, and unable to take reactions until the start of your next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage and isn't knocked prone, pushed, deafened, or prevented from taking reactions.

You touch a weapon and cause it to rumble and vibrate with loud bass when it is drawn. For the duration, the weapon is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus thunder damage on a hit equal to 3d8 + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, the weapon causes the target to be deafened for 1 minute. It makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it is no longer deafened by the spell.

You touch a weapon and cause it to erupt with prismatic flashes of light when it is drawn. For the duration, the weapon emits bright light for 20 feet and dim light for another 20 feet while it is being held, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus radiant damage on a hit equal to 3d8 + your Spellcasting modifier.
When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of its next turn.

You touch a weapon and cause it to erupt with bright crackling lightning when it is drawn. For the duration, the weapon emits bright light for 20 feet and dim light for another 20 feet while it is being held, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus lightning damage on a hit equal to 3d8 + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, the weapon gives the target disadvantage on saving throws to maintain concentration resulting from the attack's damage and the target can't take reactions or bonus actions until the end of its next turn.

A swirling cloud of gaseous green acid that smells foul and diseased appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.

A swirling cloud of icy white mist appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 10d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.

A swirling storm-cloud streaked with lightning appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.

A swirling cloud of abrasive sand that erodes those within appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 5d8 piercing and 5d8 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.

A swirling smoke cloud filled with pulses of golden eldritch starlight appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. The cloud sheds dim light in a 40-foot radius When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 10d8 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.

A massive foamy wave of transparent acid sprays in a 60-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 12d6 acid damage and is blinded for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn’t blinded by this spell. Constructs and elementals have disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature blinded by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer blinded. The spell deals damage to objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

setters.set: fire and a piece of sunstone

description.p: You are surrounded by a swirling shield of boiling lava that doesn't damage you or your equipment. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You have resistance to cold damage.
You can't be restrained by nonmagical objects.
Any creature that grapples you or begins its turn while grappling you takes 12d4 fire damage.
Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you makes a melee attack against you, the creature has disadvantage on the attack, and it takes 8d4 fire damage before the attack hits or misses.

When you are attacked with a weapon, the attack misses and the swirling lava consumes the weapon, melting it and destroying it. If ammunition was used, it is consumed instead. This doesn't happen if the weapon is magical or a natural weapon, or if the attack used magical ammunition.

description.p: A creature killed by this spell is incinerated.

When you cast this spell, the ground within 60 feet of a point that you choose within range is transformed into incredibly caustic and sticky acidic slime that extends 5 feet deep until the spell ends. A creature walking on the slime must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. Each creature that touches the slime for the first time on a turn must make a Dexterity saving throw, unless it is already restrained by the slime. On a failed save, it takes 8d6 acid damage and is restrained by the slime. On a success, it takes half damage and it isn't restrained

Each creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the slime or enters that area for the first time on a turn takes 4d6 acid damage, or 12d6 acid damage if it is restrained by the slime. When a restrained creature ends its turn, it sinks into the slime. In addition, whenever a creature falls prone within the slime or ends its turn while prone within the slime, it takes 8d6 additional acid damage and sinks into the slime. This spell treats creatures that cannot be prone as if they are always prone instead

A restrained creature can use an action to attempt to escape. It makes a Strength check against your spell save DC, with disadvantage if it has sunk into the slime. On a success, it frees itself and stands atop the slime.

The slime damages objects in the area and it flows downhill and through holes or channels (at the DM's discretion). When the spell ends, the slime cools and hardens into a soft, gelatinous surface. The surface is broken wherever a creature would be trapped inside.

setters.set: a diamond worth at least 800 gp

description.p: You electrify one creature that you can see within range, inducing a kind of magical seizure. The target is paralyzed until the spell ends, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 7d10 + 30 lightning damage, or half as much damage on a success. Water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage and are never immune to this paralysis. The target makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.
This spell has no effect on creatures that are immune to lightning damage, constructs, or plants. A creature killed by this spell is transformed completely into ashes.

You conjure a massive orb of opaque golden fire with a diameter of 20 feet at a point that you can see within range. It crashes into the ground then rolls up to 100 feet in a straight line to an unoccupied space. The orb sheds bright light in a 100-foot radius and dim light for an additional 100 feet. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried as well as those that touch the orb.

Each creature in the orb's space when it appears or in its path when it rolls must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 10d12 fire damage and be knocked prone. For the duration, you can use an action on your turn if you are within range of the orb to push it with magic, causing it to roll up to 100 feet in a straight line to an unoccupied space again.

The orb deals double damage to objects, but it can't roll through an object unless it deals enough damage to destroy the object. If the orb finishes its movement on an incline, it may roll downhill at the end of that turn (at the DM's discretion), rolling each turn until you use an action to roll it again or it reaches level ground.
When the spell ends, the orb vanishes.

A cascade of sand, boulders, gravel, and jagged shards plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range and vanish into dust only moments after impact. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 piercing damage and 20d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one cascade is affected only once. The spell damages objects in the area.

Blazing orbs of fire that spark with golden lightning plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 fire damage and 20d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once. The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren’t being worn or carried.

A primordial storm of powerful lightning bolts and thundering sound torment the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 lightning damage and 20d6 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one lightning burst is affected only once. The spell damages objects in the area.

Swirling clouds of monstrous, aberrant teeth that splash with eldritch digestive acid gnash at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 acid damage and 20d6 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one maw is affected only once. The spell damages objects in the area.

Massive jagged spikes of ice plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range and melt and vanish after impact. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 20d6 cold damage and 20d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one icy burst is affected only once. The spell damages objects in the area.

You conjure a wave of ice, snow, and glacial water in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 11d10 cold damage and 11d10 force damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes halfas much damage and is not pushed or knocked prone.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.

Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 11d10 piercing damage and 11d10 bludgeoning damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked prone.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.

On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked prone.
Until the end of your next tum, the area emits bright light for 500 feet and dim light for an additional 500 feet.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.
