description.p: You emit a massive beam of roaring, turbulent flame from your throat in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 11d10 fire damage and 11d10 thunder damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes halfas much damage and is not pushed or knocked prone.
Until the end ofyour next tum, the area emits bright light for 500 feet and dim light for an additional 500 feet. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried catch fire.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.

You emit a massive, roaring cyclone filled with rumbling thunder and arcing lightning in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 11d10 lightning damage and 11d10 thunder damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes halfas much damage and is not pushed or knocked prone.
Creatures within the spell's area are deafened.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.

description.p: You evoke a whip-like cord of searing arcane light and magical force in your free hand The whip sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to lash out with the whip, which stretches and weaves between foes. Up to five targets of your choice that you can see within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 5d8 radiant damage and 5d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Objects automatically fail the saving throw.
Damage from this spell ignores resistance, and it ignores immunity to radiant damage when dealing damage to objects.

You evoke a whip-like cord of writhing plasma that burns with hellish flame in your free hand. The whip sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to lash out with the whip, which stretches and weaves between foes. Up to five targets of your choice that you can see within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 5d8 lightning damage and 5d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Objects automatically fail the saving throw.
Damage from this spell ignores resistance, and it ignores immunity to lightning damage and fire damage when dealing damage to objects.

You unleash the power of the storm to fill up to ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range with intense electricity. Creatures that are immune to lightning damage and constructs are unaffected.

Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14d6 lightning damage and is stunned. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn’t stunned. If a target is killed by this damage, it is fried to charred bits.
A stunned target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the stunning effect ends.
You call upon an astral or celestial force to judge up to ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Creatures that have an Intelligence score of 2 or lower are unaffected.

Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14d6 radiant damage and is stunned. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn’t stunned. If a target is killed by this damage, it vanishes in a flash of light.
A stunned target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the stunning effect ends.
